contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox City Japan |Name= Mizumaki |JapaneseName= 水巻町 |settlement_type= Town |MapImage= Map Nakama en.png |Region= [[Kyūshū]] |Prefecture= [[Fukuoka Prefecture|Fukuoka]] |District=[[Onga District, Fukuoka|Onga]] |Area_km2= 11.03 |PopDate= 2003 |Population= 31,232 |Density_km2= auto |Coords= {{coord|33|51|N|130|42|E|region:JP_type:city|display=inline,title}} |LatitudeDegrees =33 |LatitudeMinutes = 51 |LatitudeSeconds = |LongtitudeDegrees = 130 |LongtitudeMinutes = 42 |LongtitudeSeconds = |Tree= Ginkgo |Flower= cosmos |Bird= |SymbolImage= |SymbolDescription= |Mayor= |CityHallPostalCode= |CityHallAddress= |CityHallPhone= |CityHallLink= [http://www.town.mizumaki.fukuoka.jp Town of Mizumaki] }} {{nihongo|'''Mizumaki'''|水巻町|Mizumaki-machi}} is a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Onga District, Fukuoka|Onga District]], [[Fukuoka Prefecture|Fukuoka]], [[Japan]]. ==Education== {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==Facilities== Mizumaki has a train station on the [[Kagoshima Main Line]], and another on the [[Fukuhoku Yutaka Line]] at Higashi-Mizumaki, both operated by [[Kyushu Railway Company]] (JR Kyushu). Mizumaki has a public library. ==Festivals== {{Empty section|date=July 2010}} ==History== About 3000 years ago, the large Ko-Onga Bay covered the area where the town of Mizumaki now lies. Soil and silt carried by the Onga River gradually built up until a flat plain was built up in the area. People began living and planting rice crops on that ground. Terrible floods continually plagued the area.<ref>Onga river http://www.town.mizumaki.lg.jp/eng/about/about03.htm Retrieved 2009-08-14</ref> In the year 1889, the village of Mizumaki was formed when nine villages merged. From that time, the population expanded as workers moved in to work in the prosperous coal mines. In 1940 Mizumaki officially became a town. Mizumaki was the site of "Japan Coal Mining Company, Onga Coal Mine" which used forced laborers in the mine, particularly Dutch, American and British POWs in [[World War II]].<ref>http://www.opendemocracy.net/arts-photography/war_2764.jsp</ref> A memorial called "The Memorial Cross " <ref>The Memorial Cross http://www.town.mizumaki.lg.jp/eng/exchang/exc.htm Retrieved 2009-08-14</ref> commemorates the allied POWs who died during the war. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} *[http://www.town.mizumaki.fukuoka.jp/ Mizumaki official website] {{ja icon}} *[http://www.town.mizumaki.fukuoka.jp/eng/ English homepage] on official website [[Category:Towns in Fukuoka Prefecture]] {{Fukuoka-geo-stub}}
